p.s: Parents and teachers alike often find themselves trying to identify emotional disabilities in children .
Early identification of any disorder helps a child to receive the help he or she needs .
Children display some actions that are very similar to others within a specific age range .
While comparison of children on a one-to-one basis is discouraged , a comparison within age groups presents a point of reference from which to work .

list.item:
Track the emotional issues the child exhibits that concern you .
Think clearly about your concerns in contrast to any social problems the child has shown .
Ask yourself if the issues are recurrent enough to warrant this alarm .
Judge these issues against other developmental or behavioral disabilities that exist with the child .

item.s: Acknowledge any other challenges that are going on .
Many emotional issues are actually developmental or behavioral disabilities .

figure.rend: Make a Behavior Intervention Plan for an Autistic Child Step 2.jpg

item.s: A child with one disability will frequently have more .
It is important to note the differences in issues .
The treatment differs in some instances .
Compare your concerns relating to one child ( quietly to yourself ) with those of others you know within the same age group .
You will then determine whether there is anything out of the norm .
Know the available health screenings that identify emotional disabilities .

figure.rend: Make a Behavior Intervention Plan for an Autistic Child Step 6.jpg

item.s: These will include vision and hearing assessments as well as psychological testing to determine intellectual development .
Deficiencies and ratings of emotional skills are noted in testing .
Combine this with historical information of abilities , education and behavior evaluations .
Investigate these screenings and determine the issues they will prove and/or rule out .
Teachers who suspect a child has emotional disabilities must investigate possibilities thoroughly .
They will discuss their suspicions with the school counselor before approaching parents .
All those involved with the child must discuss the issues together if the child is within school age .
Schedule medical or psychological assessments necessary to help the child .
Parents should make the appropriate appointments and attend them with the child .
Medical evaluations will identify or rule out many health problems that are known to cause emotional problems .
Age appropriate psychological testing requires a long block of time .
Make certain the child understands this if you go this route .
Make it clear in your mind that the medical or psychological professional you visit has all of the information on which you have based your concerns .
Follow up with the professionals recommendations as appropriate .
Discuss educational needs the physician suggests .

There are intellectual disorders that involve some very serious emotional disabilities .
Stay alert for this possibility .

item.s: Applied Behavior Analysis therapy is a controversial autism therapy that has led to tremendous success stories and stories of terror and trauma .

Be cautious , and
recognize the difference
between teaching skills and forcing compliance .
A child who is marked by peers as emotionally disabled will have difficulties in school and experience serious life problems .
